item.description:
Depending on the level of exercise you get this could be considered an easy-moderate hike.

Trailhead Directions: Take I-93 North to Exit 24, at the end of the ramp turn right and take US3 to Holderness for 4.4 miles, make a left onto NH 113 for 1.1 miles, Cotton Mountain Parking Lot on the left side of the road. So everyone has room to park please use head in parking.  Do not park sideways along the road unless the parking lot is already full.

We will be hiking the Cotton Mountain and Crawford-Ridgepole trails to the summit of Cotton Mountain (1,200') and Livermore Mountain (1,500'). There are good views of Squam Lake near both summits.

4.1 miles round trip, with an 900' elevation gain for the hike

The last few tenths of a mile of the hike will be along a tarred road with traffic so you may want to leash your dogs there.

At least at that point they will be less rambunctious, so will do better on lead.

Bring a lunch, we will eat at the top

of Livermore Mtn. while we enjoy the views of Squam Lake.

The first picture was taken at the summit of Cotton Mtn. and the second picture was taken from the summit of Livermore Mtn.

Given the distance this hike is up north a car pool will be set up.

Car Pool Location: I-93 N exit 8 Manchester, NH parking lot opposite the fire station on Mammoth Road.  Also next to the Derryfield Restaurant and Golf  Course.  Leaving at 7:45 AM.

I-93 Exit 14 Concord, NH  Fort Eddy Rd back of parking lot in between Hannafords and LL Bean.  Leaving at 8:00 AM

I-93 N exit 2 park and ride, Salem, NH. Leaving at 7:30 AM.

Any adult guest you want to bring should sign up on the meetup site as a member so they will be covered by the liability waiver. A minor would need a written waiver signed by a parent or guardian.

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: COTTON AND LIVERMORE MOUNTAINS - 900' Elevation Gain - 4.1 miles
